sections.name: Sykever (Nightwalker)
sections.text: The most common darvakkas are sykevers, walkers in the night. Bloodthirsty but calculating, they lead legions of dead into battle on the Material Plane, working toward the simple goal of ending all life.

sections.name: Darvakka
Creating Nothing
sections.text: Darvakkas are made from the quintessence, spiritual essence made manifest in physical form, of fiends cast into the void at reality's end. The death of their immortal soul causes the creature to be consumed, catalyzing a change that scrambles them into an entirely new being that retains nothing of their previous self.

sections.name: Other Darvakkas
sections.text: The darvakkas presented on these pages aren't the only ones of their kind. Others exist, most having forms like animals, from tromping hounds to skittering arachnids. All their kind are greatly powerful, and ones more powerful even than nasurgeths doubtless exist—darvakkas who may even be akin to horrific demigods.

sections.name: The Bound One
sections.text: A darvakka bound to the yoke is an incredible weapon. I have four. Only my necromantic colleges of Yled can contain them in magical stasis: a trio of sykevers alongside an ancient darvakka I simply call The Bound One. Ensnaring him secured, for my purposes, an unending pool of negative energy. We shall see if it becomes necessary to call on their services more directly and loosen their leashes.

sections.name: The End of Reality
sections.text: In the deepest reaches of darkness, where the Plane of Shadow and the Negative Energy Plane meet, is a single fixed point where reality comes to an end. This planar juncture, a chasm of solid entropy formed into crystals by the weight of the infinite compressing eternally in upon itself, is where darvakka form.

Darvakkas, also called nightshades, are a ravenous evil made up of equal parts darkness and malice. Originally creatures of the Outer Planes who travel to the convergence of the Shadow Plane and the Negative Energy Plane—where the power of nothingness obliterates them—these undead abominations are the physical embodiment of entropy. They burn with an intense hatred for all life, working to bring a final, dark night to the Material Plane where nothing but ash and ice remain.  
  
 As creatures twisted by darkness and shadow, darvakkas have a great aversion to sunlight and all sources of positive energy. On the Material Plane, they spend the hours of daylight hidden below ground, amid ruins, or submerged deep in the ocean's darkest chasms beyond the reach of the sun's rays, emerging when darkness shelters them overhead.  
  
 Darvakkas have an aura of entropy that attracts undead thralls to serve as warriors and heralds. They rarely seek alliances with each other or other creatures, existing in solitude as the heads of individual armies of the dead.

traits.name: Chaotic
traits.text: Chaotic effects often manipulate energy from chaos-aligned Outer Planes and are anathema to lawful divine servants or divine servants of lawful deities. A creature with this trait is chaotic in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Darvakka
traits.text: Entropic undead creatures twisted by the Shadow Plane and Negative Energy Plane.

traits.name: Shadow
traits.text: Magic with this trait involves shadows or the energy of the Shadow Plane. Creatures with this trait are natives of the Shadow Plane. They can survive the basic environmental effects of the Shadow Plane.

traits.name: Undead
traits.text: Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don't benefit from healing effects.

automatic_abilities.name: Entropy's Shadow

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item or a creature with a strong alignment.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

traits.name: Negative
traits.text: Effects with this trait heal undead creatures with negative energy, deal negative damage to living creatures, or manipulate negative energy. Planes with this trait are vast, empty reaches that suck the life from the living. Creatures with this trait are natives of the Negative Energy Plane. They can survive the basic environmental effects of the Negative Energy Plane.

automatic_abilities.text: Sykever leak entropy and corruption from their very being. A living creature entering or starting its turn in the aura takes 4d6 negative damage with a DC 33 basic Fortitude save. If it fails, it's also enfeebled 1 for 1 minute and pulled 10 feet toward the skyever.

automatic_abilities.name: Sunlight Powerlessness
automatic_abilities.text: A skyever caught in sunlight is stunned 2 and clumsy 2.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text:
Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. A magical item radiates a magic aura infused with its dominant school of magic.  
  
 Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

spells.name: plane shift
spells.count_text: to Material Plane; Negative Energy Plane; or Shadow Plane only

ability.name: Change Posture
ability.text: The sykever changes between their bipedal and quadrupedal stance. In their bipedal stance, the sykever can use all the abilities in their stat block except Horned Rush. In their quadrupedal stance, the sykever has a Speed of 80 feet but can't make arm spike Strikes, Disarm, cast spells, or use Crush Item.

ability.name: Crush Item
ability.trigger: The sykever gets a critical success to Disarm
ability.requirement: The sykever is in their bipedal stance
ability.effect: The sykever snatches the item and pierces it with their arm spikes. The item becomes broken and falls to the ground in the sykever's space. Items that are already broken aren't further damaged, and an item with 14 or higher Hardness is unaffected.

ability.name: Draining Gaze

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Necromancy
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the necromancy school of magic, typically involving forces of life and death.

traits.name: Visual
traits.text: A visual effect can affect only creatures that can see it. This applies only to visible parts of the effect, as determined by the GM.

ability.success: The target is enfeebled 2 for 1 round if the sykever is in bipedal stance, or clumsy 2 for 1 round if the sykever is in quadrupedal stance.
ability.failure: As success, but the effect lasts 1 minute.
ability.critical_failure: As success, but enfeebled 3 or clumsy 3, and the effect lasts 10 minutes.
ability.text: The sykever fixes their nightmarish gaze on one creature they can see, who must attempt a DC 36 Will save. Regardless of the result, the target is temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

ability.name: Horned Rush
ability.requirement: The sykever is in their quadrupedal stance
ability.effect: The sykever Strides and then makes a horn Strike.
